Title: Bluesky launches Ozone, a tool that lets users create and run their own independent moderation services
Text:
Bluesky Unveils Ozone: Empowering Users with Unprecedented Control over Social Media

Bluesky, the decentralized Twitter/X rival, has taken a bold step towards revolutionizing social media moderation. The company has open-sourced Ozone, a tool that allows individuals and teams to collaboratively review and label content on the network.

A Stackable Ecosystem of Moderation Services

Bluesky envisions a future where moderation is not a one-size-fits-all approach. Instead, it proposes a stackable ecosystem of services, where users can install filters from independent moderation services on top of Bluesky's default moderation.

This empowers users to create a customized social media experience tailored to their unique preferences and sensitivities. For instance, users who fear spiders can subscribe to a moderation service that blocks images of these eight-legged creatures.

Collaborative Curation and Reporting

Ozone goes beyond traditional mute or block lists. It enables collaborative curation and reporting. Individuals and teams can create moderation services that allow users to report unlabeled content. This eliminates the need for direct tagging and enables more efficient and effective moderation.

Moderation services are not tied to individual accounts, allowing multiple people to manage them together. This opens up the possibility for community-run projects, as well as paid subscription services.

Empowering Experts, Developers, and Users

Bluesky believes that no single team can perfectly moderate content for the diverse global community. By opening up the ecosystem, it empowers experts, developers, and users to contribute their local context and preferences.

This approach fosters a more nuanced and inclusive moderation experience, where users can choose services that align with their values and beliefs.

Availability and Future Plans

Ozone is currently available on the desktop version of Bluesky and will soon be rolled out to mobile devices. Installing filters from independent moderation services is as simple as following another account.

Bluesky's vision extends beyond individual moderation services. The company plans to introduce a "moderation marketplace" where users can discover and subscribe to a wide range of services. This will further enhance the customization and flexibility of the social media experience.

Conclusion

Bluesky's Ozone tool is a game-changer in the world of social media moderation. It empowers users with unprecedented control over their content, fostering a more personalized and inclusive online environment. By embracing collaboration and community involvement, Bluesky is paving the way for a future where moderation is tailored to the needs of each individual user.

Title: Volley's AI-enabled ball machine for racquet sports can simulate gameplay
Text:
Introducing Volley: The AI-Powered Sports Trainer Revolutionizing Racquet Sports

Prepare to elevate your racquet sports game with Volley, the cutting-edge sports tech startup that's transforming the way players train. Unlike traditional ball machines that merely hurl balls at varying speeds, Volley's AI-enabled trainer robot is a game-changer.

AI-Driven Training: A Virtual Opponent at Your Fingertips

Volley's secret weapon lies in its sophisticated AI and vision software. As you play, the trainer robot meticulously gathers data, analyzing your skill level and adapting its gameplay accordingly. It's like having a virtual opponent that responds to your every move, providing a realistic and challenging training experience.

Multi-Camera System: Capturing Every Angle

Volley's three integrated cameras serve multiple purposes. They track your movements and the ball's trajectory, ensuring precise shot delivery. One camera even peers inside the machine, allowing customer support to troubleshoot and guide you through any maintenance issues remotely.

Customizable Workouts and In-Depth Analysis

Through Volley's user-friendly mobile app, you can access a treasure trove of customized drills tailored to your needs. Review your footwork with video footage, track your progress with player stats, and digitally control the machine with a simple tap. Volley also stores your data, so you can seamlessly pick up where you left off at your next training session.

Innovation in the Racquet Sports Landscape

Volley stands out in the racquet sports tech space with its unique combination of video recording and ball dispensing. Its AI-driven approach simulates live gameplay, providing an unparalleled training experience.

From Concept to Reality: The Birth of Volley

The inspiration for Volley sparked when John Weinlader, an avid platform tennis player, grew tired of the limited training options available. He ingeniously mounted a tennis ball machine on painter sticks to mimic specific shots. After three years of tireless prototyping, Volley's game-changing trainer was born.

The Future of Racquet Sports Training

Volley is constantly evolving, adding new features to enhance your training experience. The upcoming hand gestures feature will allow you to control the trainer without even touching your phone.

Expanding Reach and Impact

Since its launch in September 2023, Volley has quickly gained traction, with 1,007 app installs and trainers deployed in 45 clubs across the US. The company has partnered with the American Platform Tennis Association to further expand its reach.

Conclusion

Volley is revolutionizing racquet sports training with its AI-powered technology and innovative approach. Whether you're a seasoned pro or a beginner looking to improve your game, Volley provides a personalized and engaging training experience that will elevate your skills to new heights.

Title: OpenMeter makes it easier for companies to track usage-based billing
Text:
Unlocking the Power of Usage-Based Pricing: How OpenMeter Empowers Businesses

In the realm of enterprise software, usage-based pricing is taking center stage. This billing model allows customers to pay only for what they use, offering flexibility and cost efficiency. However, keeping track of usage and billing can be a challenge.

The Rise of Usage-Based Pricing

Today, an estimated 60% of SaaS businesses offer usage-based pricing. Industry giants like Apigee and Autodesk have embraced this model, recognizing its benefits. But with this shift comes the need for a reliable way to monitor usage and ensure accurate billing.

Enter OpenMeter: The Usage-Based Billing Solution

OpenMeter, a company founded by former Stripe engineer Peter Marton, aims to solve the metering challenges associated with usage-based pricing. Built on Apache Kafka, an open-source platform for real-time data processing, OpenMeter tracks usage across a company's tech stack.

Key Features of OpenMeter

 Usage Event Processing: OpenMeter processes "usage events" to create human-readable consumption metrics.
 Billing and Finance Integration: These metrics are integrated with billing and finance dashboards for easy billing and revenue tracking.
 CRM Integration: Usage data is also fed into customer relationship management (CRM) databases to provide insights to product and revenue teams.
 Usage and Rate Limit Enforcement: OpenMeter can enforce usage and rate limits to prevent overconsumption and ensure fair billing.
 Hybrid Pricing Support: It supports both usage-based and hybrid pricing models, offering flexibility in billing options.

OpenMeter's Competitive Edge

In a crowded market of metering solutions, OpenMeter stands out with its unique features:

 Open Source: OpenMeter's software is freely available, making it accessible to businesses of all sizes.
 Composability: Its modular architecture allows engineering teams to incrementally adopt the solution without disrupting existing systems.
 Focus on Engineers: OpenMeter prioritizes the needs of engineers, providing a platform that empowers them to control costs and optimize usage.

Early Success and Future Prospects

OpenMeter has gained early traction, securing $3 million in funding and attracting market-leading AI companies as customers. The economic downturn has further fueled the demand for usage-based pricing and cost control, creating a favorable environment for OpenMeter's growth.

Conclusion

Usage-based pricing offers significant advantages, but it also presents billing challenges. OpenMeter addresses these challenges with its innovative platform, empowering businesses to embrace usage-based pricing with confidence. As the adoption of this pricing model continues to grow, OpenMeter is well-positioned to become a key player in the enterprise software landscape.

Title: Japan's Space One rocket launch attempt ends in a fiery explosion
Text:
Space One's Ambitious Rocket Launch Ends in a Blaze

In a bold endeavor, Space One, a Japanese startup, embarked on a mission to become the first private entity in Japan to launch a satellite into orbit. However, their aspirations were met with a fiery setback as their rocket, Kairos, exploded mere seconds after liftoff.

The 60-foot-long rocket ascended from Space Port Kii in Wakayama, Japan, carrying a satellite for the Cabinet Satellite Intelligence Center. The satellite was intended to monitor military facilities and rocket launches in North Korea.

The Anomaly and the Aftermath

Space One's director, Mamoru Endo, revealed that the rocket's automated system detected an anomaly five seconds after liftoff, triggering its self-destruct function. The cause of the anomaly remains unknown, and the company is conducting a thorough investigation.

Despite the setback, Space One's president, Masakazu Toyoda, expressed resilience. He acknowledged the prevalence of failed launches in space exploration and emphasized the company's determination to persevere.

The Road Ahead for Space One

Backed by Canon and aerospace giant IHI, Space One aims to provide cost-effective and flexible satellite launch services using small rockets. The company aspires to offer the fastest turnaround time and the most frequent launch schedule in the industry.

While Space One's initial attempt ended in disappointment, it serves as a reminder of the challenges and risks inherent in space travel. The company must now focus on identifying and resolving the anomaly that caused the explosion.

Japan's Space Ambitions

Space One's failed launch highlights the competitive nature of the private space industry in Japan. Last year, ispace, another Japanese company, faced a similar setback when it lost contact with its lunar lander, Hakuto-R.

Despite these setbacks, Japan's space agency, JAXA, continues to make strides. Its SLIM lunar lander successfully landed on the Moon in January and is preparing to resume operations.

Conclusion

Space One's failed rocket launch is a sobering reminder of the complexities of space exploration. However, it also underscores the resilience and determination of those who dare to push the boundaries of human ingenuity. As Space One and other private companies continue to innovate and learn, the future of space travel holds both promise and peril.

Title: Ontario Teachers mints new unicorn in Indian fintech Perfios
Text:
Perfios: The Indian Fintech Soaring to Unicorn Status

Perfios, a leading Indian fintech company, has secured an impressive $80 million investment from Teachers' Venture Growth, the venture arm of Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan. This investment propels Perfios to unicorn status, with a valuation exceeding $1 billion.

Transforming Financial Decision-Making

Founded in 2007, Perfios has revolutionized the financial industry with its cutting-edge credit underwriting solutions. Leveraging advanced algorithms, Perfios empowers banks, fintechs, and insurance companies to make informed decisions, reduce risk, and enhance portfolio quality.

By providing real-time data aggregation and analysis, Perfios streamlines customer journeys and accelerates decision-making processes. The company's advanced tools enable financial institutions to spot fraud, assess creditworthiness, and optimize their lending operations.

Global Expansion and Acquisition Ambitions

Perfios plans to utilize the fresh capital to expand its global footprint and pursue strategic acquisitions. With a presence in nearly two dozen markets, the company aims to become a dominant player in the global fintech landscape.

A Journey of Success

Perfios's success is a testament to its unwavering commitment to innovation and customer satisfaction. The company has consistently exceeded expectations, delivering exceptional results year after year.

"Our business has witnessed remarkable growth, driven by our unwavering focus on delivering value to our partners," said Sabyasachi Goswami, CEO of Perfios. "We are grateful for the trust and support we have received throughout our journey."

A Unicorn in the Making

Perfios's impressive growth trajectory has earned it the distinction of being the second Indian unicorn of 2023. With its strong financial performance and ambitious expansion plans, Perfios is poised to continue its ascent in the global fintech market.

"We are thrilled to invest in Perfios, a leader in the B2B enterprise tech space in India," said Kelvin Yu, Senior Managing Director of Teachers' Venture Growth in Asia. "Their exceptional team and innovative solutions have positioned them as a key player in the fintech industry."

Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan's India Focus

Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan, one of Canada's largest pension funds, has expressed its commitment to investing in India. Perfios's investment is part of the fund's broader strategy to deploy $3 billion in India by 2030.

This investment reflects the growing opportunities in India's tech sector and the potential of Indian companies to achieve global success. Perfios's unicorn status is a testament to the innovation and entrepreneurial spirit that is driving India's economic growth.

Title: Intel introduces approach to boost power efficiency, reliability of packaged chiplet ecosystems
Text:
Unveiling the Power of Chiplet Interconnects: A New Era of Computing Performance

In the realm of computing, the integration of electronic components has undergone a remarkable transformation. From the humble beginnings of central processing units (CPUs) connected to memory units, we've witnessed the rise of sophisticated integrated circuit (IC) architectures that harness the power of multiple chiplets.

Intel Corporation has been at the forefront of this evolution, introducing innovative architectures and specifications for systems featuring multiple packaged chiplets. Recently, researchers at Intel Santa Clara have proposed a groundbreaking approach that promises to revolutionize the performance of these systems.

Beyond the Limits of Frequency: Embracing Lower Frequencies for Enhanced Efficiency

Traditionally, the pursuit of higher performance in electronic systems has been synonymous with increasing the frequency of circuits. However, Intel's latest research challenges this long-held belief.

The team has discovered that by reducing the frequency in UCIe (Universal Chiplet Interconnect Express) systems, a specification that standardizes connections between chiplets, they can achieve significant gains in both power efficiency and overall performance.

The Intriguing Case of Bump Pitches

Advances in silicon and packaging technology have enabled the reduction of bump pitches, the minimum distance between the bumps connecting individual chips on circuit boards. This reduction in bump pitch means more wires can be accommodated between chiplets.

Counterintuitively, the researchers found that instead of increasing the frequency as the number of wires increases, lowering the frequency in UCIe-aligned technologies leads to improved power efficiency and performance.

A New Frontier for Computing Performance

This groundbreaking discovery opens up exciting possibilities for the future of computing. By embracing lower frequencies in chiplet-based systems, designers can unlock unprecedented levels of performance while simultaneously reducing power consumption.

This approach has the potential to revolutionize a wide range of applications, from high-performance computing to energy-efficient mobile devices.

The Road Ahead: Standardization and Industry Collaboration

Intel's researchers believe that their findings can benefit the broader industry through the standardization of chiplet interconnects. By working together, the industry can accelerate the adoption of this transformative technology and drive the next generation of computing innovation.

As the journey of chiplets and UCIe continues, the future holds immense promise for the advancement of computing performance and efficiency. Intel's groundbreaking research has set the stage for a new era of innovation, where the boundaries of computing are constantly being pushed.

Title: Journey acquires mental health startup Felt to enhance its employee assistance program
Text:
Journey's Acquisition of Felt: A Leap Towards Personalized Mental Health Support

In a groundbreaking move, Journey, a renowned employee-centric mental health provider, has acquired Felt, a pioneering startup specializing in AI-powered therapist matching. This strategic acquisition marks a significant step in Journey's mission to revolutionize employee well-being and mental health support.

Felt's innovative technology harnesses natural language processing and machine learning to analyze key factors that contribute to a successful therapist-client pairing. By considering communication styles, personality traits, and shared values, Felt's AI predicts compatibility with remarkable accuracy.

Integrating AI and Human Expertise

Journey's CEO, Stephen Sokoler, envisions integrating Felt's AI capabilities into their Proactive EAP platform. This integration will enhance Journey's existing therapist matching process by combining AI-driven insights with the expertise of human clinicians.

Master's-Level Clinicians on Journey's platform will leverage Felt's technology to identify the ideal therapist for each employee's unique needs. This seamless collaboration ensures that employees receive personalized and effective mental health support.

A Shared Vision for Emotional Well-being

Felt's co-founder and CEO, Aaron Albert, expressed his excitement about the acquisition, stating that it aligns perfectly with their goal of making emotional wellness support accessible and tailored to individual needs. By joining forces with Journey, Felt's AI-driven matching innovations will reach a wider audience through Journey's extensive network.

Journey's Growth and Impact

Since its inception, Journey has experienced remarkable growth, expanding by an impressive 800%. The company has raised $6 million in funding and has partnered with reputable organizations such as Georgetown University and Regneron.

This acquisition underscores Journey's commitment to providing cutting-edge mental health solutions that empower employees to thrive. By harnessing the power of AI and human expertise, Journey is transforming the way individuals access and receive the support they need to maintain their emotional well-being.

Conclusion

Journey's acquisition of Felt is a testament to the growing recognition of mental health as a crucial aspect of overall well-being. By leveraging AI and human expertise, Journey is pioneering a new era of personalized mental health support, ensuring that employees have access to the right care, at the right time, and in the most effective way possible.

Title: Pint-size pickup startup Telo Trucks finds unexpected niche in fleet customers
Text:
Telo Trucks: Revolutionizing the Pickup Landscape for Fleets and Lifestyle Enthusiasts

In the realm of automotive innovation, Telo Trucks has emerged as a trailblazer, capturing the attention of both everyday drivers and fleet managers alike with its pint-sized electric pickup. While the company initially targeted individuals seeking a compact, convenient lifestyle vehicle, an unexpected surge of interest from fleet operators has propelled Telo into uncharted territory.

Fleet Customers Embrace the Mini Pickup

Fleet managers, particularly those operating in urban environments, have long lamented the scarcity of small trucks in the market. Traditional pickup trucks have grown in size and price, leaving a void for vehicles that can navigate congested city streets and fulfill specific fleet requirements.

Telo's pint-sized pickup has filled this gap, offering a solution that eliminates the need for fleet companies to purchase both neighborhood electric vehicles and full-size pickups to meet their diverse operational needs. This unique opportunity has fueled Telo's growth, attracting a growing number of fleet customers.

Funding Fueling Development and Expansion

To capitalize on this demand, Telo has secured a $5.4 million funding round led by Neo and Spero Ventures. The investment will enable the company to forge deeper relationships with potential fleet customers and develop fully functional press vehicles that showcase the final product's design and performance.

Overcoming Technical Hurdles

Creating a compact pickup that meets safety standards poses unique engineering challenges. Telo's team is exploring innovative solutions beyond traditional crumple zones to protect occupants in the event of a crash. By utilizing the space where an engine would typically reside, they aim to enhance occupant safety without compromising the vehicle's compact design.

Production Strategy: Small-Scale, Niche Focus

To ensure profitability and avoid the pitfalls that have plagued other automotive startups, Telo is adopting a low-volume production strategy. The company plans to utilize off-the-shelf components with minimal modifications and collaborate with domestic contract manufacturers specializing in smaller-scale production.

This approach allows Telo to target specific use cases and niches where they face minimal competition. By focusing on low volumes, they can achieve profitability and minimize the risks associated with mass production.

Conclusion

Telo Trucks has tapped into a growing demand for compact, electric pickups, attracting both lifestyle enthusiasts and fleet customers. With its innovative design, strategic partnerships, and a focus on low-volume production, Telo is poised to revolutionize the pickup landscape. As the company continues to develop its pint-sized pickup, it will undoubtedly face challenges, but its unique approach and unwavering commitment to meeting the needs of its customers position it for success in the years to come.

Title: Kolet makes travel eSIM cards easier to navigate
Text:
Kolet: Revolutionizing Travel Connectivity with eSIM

Imagine a world where staying connected on your travels is as seamless as booking a flight or hotel room. Kolet, a French startup, is making this vision a reality with its innovative eSIM distribution strategy.

eSIM: The Future of Travel Connectivity

eSIM (embedded SIM) technology is revolutionizing the way we connect to cellular networks. Unlike traditional physical SIM cards, eSIMs are embedded directly into your smartphone, allowing you to switch carriers and plans with just a few taps.

For years, eSIMs have been the default option for iPhones in the US. Now, Kolet is bringing this convenience to travelers worldwide. By partnering with travel companies, Kolet makes it easier than ever to access reliable and affordable connectivity on the go.

Kolet's Unique Approach

Kolet stands out in the crowded eSIM market with its unique distribution strategy. Instead of relying solely on comparison websites, Kolet partners with travel agencies and booking platforms to promote its services.

When you book a flight or hotel with a Kolet partner, you'll receive a confirmation email offering a free trial of Kolet's eSIM service. This trial includes 1GB of data for the first two days of your trip, giving you peace of mind and the ability to stay connected from the moment you arrive.

Seamless User Experience

Kolet's user experience is designed to be as simple as possible. After installing the Kolet eSIM, you can easily top up your plan through the app. Plans start at just €3.99 for 1GB of data in Europe, with a 30-day validity period.

Kolet's ultimate goal is to create a single eSIM that works in every country in the world. This means no more hassle of reinstalling eSIMs as you cross borders.

The Kolet Team

Kolet's team is a powerhouse of experience in the tech and travel industries. Co-founder and CEO Eduardo Ronzano has a proven track record in healthcare and angel investing. Chief Marketing Officer Anne-Carole Cöen brings expertise from leading tech companies like Swile and Frichti.

Chief Technology Officer Jérémy Gotteland has experience in the quick delivery space, while Chief Operating Officer Mehdi Chraibi has worked for Millicom and Orange.

Investment and Advisors

Kolet has secured €5 million in funding from Daphni and 9900 Capital. The startup has also enlisted the guidance of industry experts as advisors to ensure its success.

The Future of Travel Connectivity

Kolet is poised to transform the way we stay connected while traveling. By partnering with travel companies and offering a seamless user experience, Kolet is making eSIM technology accessible to everyone.

With its innovative approach and experienced team, Kolet is well-positioned to become the leading provider of eSIM services for travelers worldwide.
